name: Energy-Flow Cosmology (EFC) Core Concepts
description: A unified thermodynamic framework connecting cosmic structure, dynamics, and cognition through energy flow and entropy.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Energy-Flow Cosmology (EFC)
hasDefinedTerm.description: The unified thermodynamic framework linking cosmic structure, dynamics, and cognition through energy and entropy flow.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Grid–Higgs Framework
hasDefinedTerm.description: A model interpreting gravitation, dark matter, and black holes as emergent phenomena driven by entropic gradients and the Grid–Higgs field interaction.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Halo Model of Entropy
hasDefinedTerm.description: Underlying model for the formation and function of galactic halos as entropy regulators in cosmic clusters.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Energy–Flow Interface
hasDefinedTerm.description: The unified thermodynamic interpretation of Dark Matter, Dark Energy, and the CMB within the Grid–Higgs framework.

hasDefinedTerm.name: Energy-Flow Dynamics (EFD)
hasDefinedTerm.description: Sub-model describing cosmic expansion, gravitation, and time as emergent properties of energy-rate density and entropy flow.

hasDefinedTerm.name: CEM-Cosmos
hasDefinedTerm.description: A field-theoretic model of consciousness coupled to Energy-Flow Cosmology, extending thermodynamic logic to cognitive systems.
